ctl:function.name: kml:isValidGeometry
ctl:function.ctl:param: A DOM Node representing a KML geometry element.
A string value specifying a key to access an exception message (using the kml:getValidationMessage() function)
ctl:function.ctl:return: A boolean value: true if the given node represents a valid geometry instance.
ctl:function.ctl:description: Checks that the geometry is topologically correct.

ctl:function.name: kml:getErrorMessage
ctl:function.ctl:param: A string value specifying the key to look up a validation error message.
ctl:function.ctl:return: A string containing a detail message (an empty string if no message exists).
ctl:function.ctl:description: Retrieves the message describing why a geometry instance is invalid.
